title: Wow, this guy can chuck an Extinction Rebellion sign blocking the street really, really far – twitchy.com
text:
Here’s something you’re sure to enjoy. We’re not sure which we like better: the guy absconding with Extinction Rebellion sign and chucking it over the fence, or the climate change alarmist who, freed from her videography duties, desperately runs into the middle of the intersection to block several lanes of traffic from four directions.

Here’s the view from one of the protester’s cameras:

you have officially left the safe space pic.twitter.com/KKg4ZwO1BP — TyIer (@tyIerzilla) October 18, 2019

And here’s the view from above, which really captures the magic:

Hah. This is so good dude, I’m so glad to see the view from below. pic.twitter.com/XuMavivG4q — Micah|Micycle 🎃 (@Micycle444) October 19, 2019

By the way, you know it’s Extinction Rebellion from their logo: the red hourglass-looking thing inside the circle. They’re the same clowns who recently climbed on top of a British Airways jet and a London commuter train (which did not go well for them, nor for the woman who glued herself to the train).

Intentionally blocking traffic in order to inflict a political message on others is one of the more evil things anyone can do. You're delaying emergency vehicles, placing lives at risk and causing massive upheaval in peoples' lives. AND it's doing NOTHING for your 'cause'. — Furrystoat ن (@Furrystoat) October 19, 2019

Beyond that is a form of tyranny! I decide something is a problem and what has to be done to fix it and everyone else is going to do as I decide or I will interrupt their lives! This thinking is how tyrants use useful idiots to place them in power! — Indy Visualist (@IVisualist) October 19, 2019

Good for him. Sick of these pansy protesters with no job preventing hard working Americans from getting to theirs — 🇺🇸America First Stacy (@Discoveringme40) October 18, 2019

I’d donate to his go fund me . That was the most beautiful video I’ve seen. That sound of her cellphone scraping across the pavement will be my new go to sound when I need to go to sleep:) RISE UP AMERICA! — Mom Mary (@coff33loveit) October 18, 2019

Dude's wearing scrubs. He's trying to save lives and pay bills. #hero — NO STEP ON SNEK (@krewemaynard) October 19, 2019

The guy could be a surgeon on his way to an open chest heart surgery. Patients could be literally dying waiting for him to show up and save their lives. I would be mad too. — Artifical AI (@AiArtifical) October 19, 2019

I’d could give a shit what his reason was, dude could work at McDonald’s, and I’d still say fuck yeah! — Ryan Gilbert (@BigR62468) October 19, 2019

I’ve watched this like 15 times and I love it more every time I watch it. — Cody Lockhart (@lockhart_uk) October 18, 2019

this man is awesome.. — Democracy? wtf.. (@Democracy_wtf) October 18, 2019

Can I buy that guy a beer — Cigol (@cigoltonk) October 18, 2019

That man… Is incredibly based. — デフスキ (@Linkzor8) October 18, 2019

😂 I GOTTA GO TO WORK! Damn a real man — Joy Villa (@Joy_Villa) October 19, 2019

This guy seriously needs a National holiday, annual parades and a 100’ Statue erected in his image made of pure gold! — Mali007 (@Malichi007) October 19, 2019

I can’t stop watching this — Charles Martel (Your Guilty Liberal Conscience) (@Charles29629184) October 18, 2019

When her phone said 🔄🔄🔄🔄🔄🔄 I felt that — Will Causey (@thewilliepoo) October 18, 2019

If someone watches this and feels something other than “wow good for him” that’s a problem. — Frankie D (@checkraiseyou) October 18, 2019

That’s called a life lesson that their parents should’ve taught them. — Bdubs (@bdubs_ben) October 19, 2019

The audacity of the lady saying "what is wrong with you" And the response of "they gotta go to work" This man deserves a raise whatever healthcare place he works at — 🎃 Shredder 2025 🎃 (@SHREDDER2025) October 19, 2019

Someone should at least find out who he is and start a go fund me to give him a reward! — Andrew Potter (@drewcuse) October 19, 2019

Just left his 24 hr emergency room shift and not having any of it. — Utopuss (@leakstreets) October 18, 2019

Yes- I was thinking the same thing. Probably was waiting for his replacement to come in to relieve his shift… and the camp fire girls were playing in the street. — The Brightest Light (@Dawn48789363) October 19, 2019

Protesting: the answer to the question of how the 3.5% who are unemployed spend their days. — MarkHyman (@MarkHyman) October 18, 2019

The “Cloverfield” ending was priceless. Well played, sir, well played! — furious_pounces_a (@furious_a) October 19, 2019

That was beyond satisfying — 🇭🇰 Roon Kolos 🏳️‍🌈 It Just Works (@RoonKolos) October 19, 2019

Related:
description: Extinction Rebellion protesters really know how to win people over to their lunatic cause.
